summary: Email from Brittany Henderson, a trial attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC, to FBI contacts regarding assistance for four victims who were minors when abused by Jeffrey Epstein. The email seeks to coordinate services for the victims.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Author of the email, working at Edwards Pottinger LLC, reaching out to FBI contacts to help four minor victims of Jeffrey Epstein obtain services.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Cc'd on the email, likely a colleague or partner at Edwards Pottinger LLC.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI agent in New York, recipient of the email regarding victim services for Epstein's minor victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', the perpetrator who abused the four minor victims mentioned in the email.

connections.description: Attorney communicating with FBI agent regarding victim services for Epstein case.
Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC, with Edwards cc'd on the email.
Epstein abused four minor victims, as stated in the email.

events.title: Request for Victim Services
events.description: Brittany Henderson emails FBI contacts to coordinate services for four minor victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Four victims were minors when abused by Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney Brittany Henderson is seeking FBI assistance to help these victims obtain services.
The communication highlights ongoing legal and support efforts for Epstein's victims in 2020.
The email is addressed to FBI contacts in New York, indicating federal involvement in victim assistance.
